chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M. Meinecke #309150 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:22 a.m. Defendant Todd M. Meinecke in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Scholke.  Asst. DA, Jillian Pfeifer, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CF195, 15CF303, 17CF79, 16TR2473, 16FO890. Pfeifer speaks to resolution; Scholke free to argue sentence. State moves to dismiss 17CF79; moves to rescind DEJ in 15CF303; granted by the court. In 16CF195 the State moves to amend Ct. 1 to resisting, s. 946.41 and dismiss Cts. 2 and 4; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 and amended and Ct. 3, OWI 6th in 16CF195. Pfeifer/Scholke/Meineckef statement to sentencing. Court statement. Court speaks to bond forfeiture in 16CF195; Court denied forfeiture of $1,000; orders returned to Mr. Angell; DOC to collect fine/court costs as courtesy.

1:30 p.m. Defendant Todd M. Meinecke in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Arbuckle. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF303, 16CF195, 16FO890 and 16TR2473. Arbuckle files Waiver of Preliminary Hearing in 16CF195. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Arraignment scheduled for 10/3/16 at 3:30 p.m. Regarding 15CF303, counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Schiek speaks to deferred judgment as to Ct. 2; intends to file motion to rescind that DPA. Arbuckle wishes to proceed today with Ct. 1. Schiek/Arbuckle/Meinecke statement to sentencing. Court statement--balance of court costs reviewed at next hearing. Schiek will notice motion for 10/3/16 at 3:30 p.m. with status on traffic matters same date and time.

3:06 p.m. Defendant Todd M. Meinecke in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Todd M. Meinecke in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - Hogan in receipt of Information- waive reading - Hogan enters no contest to both counts. Plea questionnaire filed.  Deferred Entry of Judgment filed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty on Count 1 and defers entry of judgment and accepts agreement on Count 2.
